Package template

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • template.Parser
  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple parser for parsing text files.

    Empty lines (no characters or only white space) or comment lines (starting with a '#') are ignored.

    Implement your parsing logic in parseFile().

    • Constructor Summary

      Parser construction.

      • parseLineToTokens

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parseLineToTokens​(java.lang.String line)
        Parses a line skipping white space. Note: use parseLineToTokens(String line, char comment) to parse files that may contain comment.
        Parameters:
        line -
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings containing the tokens in the line

      • parseLineToTokens

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parseLineToTokens​(java.lang.String line,
                                                                      char comment)
        Parses a line skipping white space. If a comment character is parsed, the remaining line will be skipped. Note: a line can start with a comment, resulting in an ArrayList with the size of zero.
        Parameters:
        line -
        comment - a comment character (e.g. shells use "#")
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings containing the tokens in the line

        Returns:
        Throws:

      • tokenizeToArrayList

        public static void tokenizeToArrayList​(java.util.StringTokenizer tokenizer,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tokens)
        Clears an ArrayList and adds all tokens of the given StringTokenizer to it.
        Parameters:
        tokenizer - the StringTokenizer containing the tokens, must not be null
        tokens - the ArrayList, must not be null
